business.headline: India bans all imports from Pakistan in response to Pahalgam terror attackIn a strong response to the Pahalgam terror attack, India has banned both direct and indirect imports from Pakistan and denied Pakistani ships access to Indian ports. Although direct imports were minimal, some goods were entering through third-party countries.

India bans imports from Pak, bars port access in tough moves post PahalgamThe move comes after India announced the closure of the Attari-Wagah land border following the Pahalgam attack, crippling bilateral trade.
Mutual funds are on the rise again. Check out these 5 bets in 2025Choosing the right mutual fund depends on how much risk you're comfortable with and how long you plan to invest.

Oyo delays IPO attempt for 3rd time as largest shareholder opposes: ReportIndia's Nifty 50 index has risen about 3% in 2025 so far, but it's still over 7% below its all-time high from October last year. This market volatility has affected several companies.

UPI witnesses small dip in April, but yearly growth remains strongAccording to data from the National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI), UPI processed 17.89 billion transactions in April, which is about 2.2% less than March's 18.30 billion.

Adani's nephew accused of insider trading by Sebi, seeks settlement: ReportThe scrutiny is the latest challenge for the Adani group. US authorities last year indicted Gautam Adani and two Adani Green executives for allegedly paying bribes to secure Indian power supply contracts and misleading US investors. The group has denied the charges and called them "baseless".
Sensex ends 260 points higher, Nifty above 24,300; Adani Ports gains 4%The S&P BSE Sensex rose 259.75 points to close at 80,501.99, while the NSE Nifty50 ended just 12.50 points higher at 24,346.70.
Zoho halts $700 million chip manufacturing plan. Here's whyZoho, started in 1996, is known for offering affordable business software and services to companies around the world.

Vizhinjam port inaugurated: What makes it a strategic gem for IndiaThe Vizhinjam port has a natural sea depth of around 20 metres, making it suitable for very large ships without the need for deep digging, which is common in other ports.

UPI payments to get faster from June 16: What it means for youNPCI shared in its latest circular stated that from June 16, 2025, UPI users can expect quicker responses when checking the status of a transaction or reversing a payment.

Rupee at strongest since October 2024 as it breaks 84/dollar markThis marks a nearly 2% weekly gain for the rupee, powered by a sustained rally in Indian equities and growing optimism over an early US-India trade deal under the Trump administration.

Zomato shares rise despite 78% drop in Q4 profit. Should you buy, hold or sell?Eternal posted revenue of Rs 5,830 crore, broadly in line with analyst estimates. EBITDA margin slipped to 1.2%—falling short of expectations—but the company managed to maintain stable contribution margins in both food delivery and quick commerce.

entertainment.headline: Good Bad Ugly OTT release: When, where to watch Ajith's action comedyAfter doing decent business at the box office, Ajith Kumar's latest release Good Bad Ugly is set for its OTT debut. An action-comedy, the film is directed by Adhik Ravichandran and will premiere on Netflix.

HIT 3 vs Retro box office Day 2: Nani's film outshines Suriya's thrillerIt has been a roaring start to the South films HIT 3 and Retro. However, by Day 2, Nani's cop-thriller overpowered Suriya's Tamil thriller at the domestic box office.

Vijay Deverakonda clarifies viral tribal remarks: I express my sincere regretActor Vijay Deverakonda issued a statement and clarified his recent remarks on the tribal community. The actor stated that he did not intend to hurt the sentiments of anyone.

Pakistani singer Abida Parveen's Instagram account blocked in IndiaVeteran Pakistani singer Abida Parveen's Instagram account has been blocked in India. This comes in the wake of the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir on April 22.

Why audiences can't get enough of heist thrillersHeist thrillers have captivated Indian audiences with their blend of drama, suspense, and moral complexity. From iconic films like Special 26 to the recent Jewel Thief, these stories offer a thrilling escape, inviting viewers to root for charismatic anti-heroes. In this week's Cinematic Saturday, we explore why audiences, actors and filmmakers love the genre.

Hanumankind confirms his track in Thalapathy Vijay's final film Jana NayaganRapper Hanumankind confirmed teaming up with composer Anirudh Ravichander for Thalapaty Vijay's upcoming film, 'Jana Nayagan'.

Raid 2 box office: Ajay Devgn's thriller crosses Rs 30 crore in two daysAjay Devgn's 'Raid 2' has kicked off strongly at the box office, raking in over Rs 31 crore in its first two days. Directed by Raj Kumar Gupta, the film released in theatres on May 1.

She lived a full, joyful life: Boney Kapoor's mourns mother Nirmal's deathBoney Kapoor shared an emotional note in the wee hours of Saturday and mourned the death of his mother, Nirmal Kapoor. She was survived by four children- Boney, Anil, Sanjay, and Reena Kapoor.

Heidi Gardner and Bobby Ray join star-packed cast of Ferrell's 'Judgment Day'Heidi Gardner and golfer Bobby Ray join Will Ferrell and Zac Efron in Amazon MGM's comedy Judgment Day, directed by Nicholas Stoller. The film follows a convict hijacking a courtroom show.

Gal Gadot and Matthias Schoenaerts to star in WW II thriller 'Ruin' from Niki CaroGal Gadot and Matthias Schoenaerts will star in Ruin, a WWII revenge thriller directed by Niki Caro. Filming begins in 2026, with international sales launched at Cannes Film Market.

Ed Sheeran's 'Play' album out in September, draws Persian and Indian influencesEd Sheeran has announced his new album Play, out September 12, with the release of "Old Phone." The globally inspired album was finalized in India and features Persian and Indian sounds.

Complaint against Sonu Nigam for 'provocative' remarks at Bengaluru concertA Kannada outfit has accused Sonu Nigam of stoking "linguistic enmity" at a Bengaluru concert over the singer's remarks linking a fan's Kannada song request to the Pahalgam terror attack.

From music to filmmaking: Create in India Challenge awards winners at WAVES 2025The Waves Create in India Challenge Awards, in partnership with India Today, were held at WAVES Summit 2025 in Mumbai. Take a look at the winners here.

Kolkata honours Satyajit Ray with crowdfunded street museumKolkata unveils a unique crowdfunded street museum to honour Satyajit Ray. This initiative marks a significant cultural tribute to the legendary filmmaker on his 104th birth anniversary.

Salman Khan's films go wrong as he tries to accommodate friends: Shehzad KhanVeteran actor Shehzad Khan calls out criticism against Salman Khan, highlighting his generosity, loyalty, and enduring mass appeal. He shared the screen with the superstar in 'Andaz Apna Apna', which was recently re-released in theatres.

Virat Kohli calls Nee Singam Dhan his favourite song, actor Simbu reactsDuring a recent chat show, cricketing superstar Virat Kohli revealed that his favourite song right now was AR Rahman's 'Nee Singham Dhan' from the Tamil film 'Pathu Thala' starring Silambarasan TR aka Simbu.

Kiara Advani to walk the MET Gala 2025 red carpet wearing Gaurav GuptaSoon-to-be mother Kiara Advani is set to make her Met Gala debut in 2025 in a custom Gaurav Gupta outfit. She will be joined by Shah Rukh Khan, Diljit Dosanjh, and Priyanka Chopra, marking a grand moment for Indian stars on the global fashion stage.

Alia Bhatt to join Aishwarya Rai, Eva Longoria for Cannes red carpet debutAlia Bhatt is set to make her Cannes Film Festival debut. She will join the roster of Loreal global ambassadors, including Aishwarya Rai and Eva Longoria among others.

After Paresh Rawal, Anu Aggarwal claims she drank her urine: It's amritActor Anu Aggarwal came out in support of veteran actor Paresh Rawal's claims about the health benefits of drinking one's own urine. During a recent event, she revealed that she had also tried it herself and claimed that there were anti-aging effects on her skin.

general news.headline: India bans imports from Pak, bars port access in tough moves post PahalgamThe move comes after India announced the closure of the Attari-Wagah land border following the Pahalgam attack, crippling bilateral trade.

Pak claims it tested ballistic missile with 450 km range amid tension with IndiaThe surface-to-surface ballistic missile, known as the Abdali Weapon System, was tested as part of Pakistan's military drill 'Exercise INDUS'.

Pak minister's fresh threat: Will strike any structure built to divert Indus waterIndia had suspended the Indus Waters Treaty, which ensures water for 80% of Pakistani agricultural land, hours after the Pahalgam terror attack.
Visual explainer: What makes hunt for Pahalgam attackers so challengingTen days have passed since the launch of a mega search operation but terrorists are still at large

Why caste census announced now? Big bet on nationalism or bid to distract?The BJP-led government took the Opposition by surprise by announcing a caste enumeration in the Census. A big surprise was the timing of the announcement, coming just days after the Pahalgam terror attack. Is the BJP trying to make use of the surge in nationalism after the attack or is it trying to buy some time?

'Europe's problems...': Experts cite Jaishankar, pan EU's hypocrisy on PahalgamAs the EU's top diplomat, Kaja Kallas, urged India and Pakistan to exercise restraint, several experts went on an overdrive in slamming her for maintaining double standards.

Video: Devotees push each other as cops struggle to manage crowd at Goa templeAt least seven people died and more than 80 were injured after a stampede broke out during a temple festival in North Goa's Shirgao village in the wee hours of Saturday. The incident took place at the Sree Lairai Devi temple.

Angry young man Shubman Gill shows glimpse of future avatar in IPL 2025Shubman Gill was left furious several times on Friday, May 2 as GT thrashed SRH in Ahmedabad. Was this the first glimpse of a passionate leader that the fans got to see in the Indian Premier League?

Vijay Deverakonda clarifies viral tribal remarks: I express my sincere regretActor Vijay Deverakonda issued a statement and clarified his recent remarks on the tribal community. The actor stated that he did not intend to hurt the sentiments of anyone.

Congress MP questions surgical strikes, BJP says 'go to Pak with Rahul Gandhi'Congress MP Charanjit Singh Channi sparked a row by questioning the 2019 surgical strikes, saying "no one saw them" and demanding proof. His remarks drew sharp criticism from BJP leaders, who accused him of demoralising the armed forces.

Bangladesh should occupy Northeast states if India attacks Pak: Yunus's aideBangladesh Chief Adviser Muhammad Yunus's aide suggested that if India attacks Pakistan, Bangladesh should occupy the northeastern states of India and initiate talks with China for a joint military arrangement.

Laid-off techie says life in India feels 'unliveable' after 10 years in USAfter being laid off and losing his green card hopes, a techie returned to India, only to feel like a stranger in his own country.

Why audiences can't get enough of heist thrillersHeist thrillers have captivated Indian audiences with their blend of drama, suspense, and moral complexity. From iconic films like Special 26 to the recent Jewel Thief, these stories offer a thrilling escape, inviting viewers to root for charismatic anti-heroes. In this week's Cinematic Saturday, we explore why audiences, actors and filmmakers love the genre.

NEET UG 2025 on May 4: Mock drills, security checks and new exam law in forceNEET UG 2025 will be conducted on May 4 across 5453 centres. Mock drills, biometric checks and 3-level monitoring are planned to ensure secure, fair exams under the new Unfair Means law.

7 killed, 80 injured in Goa temple stampede, Chief Minister announces inquiryAt least seven people were killed and over 30 injured in a stampede during the Shri Lairai Zatra festival in Goa's Shirgao on Friday night. Chief Minister Pramod Sawant and Prime Minister Narendra Modi expressed condolences, while authorities continue to investigate the cause.

Pakistani singer Abida Parveen's Instagram account blocked in IndiaVeteran Pakistani singer Abida Parveen's Instagram account has been blocked in India. This comes in the wake of the terror attack in Jammu and Kashmir on April 22.

Delhi woman claims Nainital cop slapped her and friend, shares video. Police reactsA Delhi-based woman claimed she and her friend were slapped by a policeman at a checkpoint in Uttarakhand's Nainital.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!
KJo, Ayan Mukerji, Farhan Akhtar, and celebs at Anil Kapoor's mother's funeralAnil Kapoor's mother, Nirmal, died on May 2 at 90. Her funeral is taking place at Vile Parle crematorium in Mumbai.

Does alcohol actually calm your nerves?Alcohol does act as a sedative on the central nervous system. So yes, in the moment, you might feel relaxed, your thoughts may slow down, and those butterflies in your stomach might ease, but...

Man flies with falcon on UAE flight, and the bird even has its own passportA man in the UAE stunned a fellow passenger as he said he was travelling with his falcon, which has its own passport. A video of their interaction went viral.

This Ax-4 study could pave the way for diabetic astronauts in spaceFor decades, people with diabetes were told they couldn't become astronauts. However, if this new study being launched aboard the Ax-4 mission is successful, that could change forever.

8, including main accused, arrested in ex-Bajrang Dal member's murder caseThe 42-year-old Shetty was a controversial figure in Karnataka's coastal politics and was well-known in the region with a criminal record. He had five criminal cases registered against him.

Pakistan violates LoC ceasefire for 9th straight night, Army respondsSince the night of April 24, just hours after India suspended the Indus Waters Treaty following the killing of 26 people in the terror attack, Pakistani troops have been resorting to unprovoked firing at various places along the LoC in J&K, beginning from the Kashmir Valley.

sports.headline: Can't see Pakistan being part of Asia Cup after Pahalgam attack: Sunil GavaskarSunil Gavaskar feels that Pakistan won't be a part of the upcoming Asia Cup in India and Sri Lanka after the Pahalgam terror attack last month. The Asia Cup is set to take place later this year.

CSK need to stick with their youngsters: Finch's advice to struggling IPL teamIPL 2025: Aaron Finch said that the Chennai Super Kings need to stick to their youngsters to bounce back from their disastrous campaign this season where they failed to qualify for the playoffs.

Iga Swiatek lost her grandfather before Madrid Open, confirms managerWorld No.2 Iga Swiatek lost her grandfather before taking part in the Madrid Open. Swiatek crashed out of the WTA 1000 tournament after losing to Coco Gauff in the semis.

Shubman Gill is no less than Virat Kohli in terms of consistency: Ajay JadejaAjay Jadeja has claimed that when it comes to consistency in IPL, Shubman Gill is on par with Virat Kohli. Gill scored his fifth fifty of the IPL 2025 season against SRH on Friday, May 2.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi India debut? Wait till next IPL is over, says Sunil GavaskarSpeaking to Sports Today, Sunil Gavaskar feels that people should wait till the next season of IPL is over before judging Vaibhav Suryavanshi and considering him worthy of an Indian team debut.

RCB vs CSK in Bengaluru is something else: Virat Kohli on intense rivalryVirat Kohli has claimed that the environment for a RCB vs CSK clash in Bengaluru is one of the most exciting ones he has been part of. RCB and CSK will face off at the Chinnaswamy once again on Saturday, May 3.

Vaibhav Arora credits Bravo, Bharat Arun for improved death bowlingIPL 2025: In an exclusive chat with Sports Today, KKR fast bowler Vaibhav Arora said how working with Bharat Arun and Bharat Arun has helped him become a better death bowler.

Did MS Dhoni play one season too many in IPL 2025? Sunil Gavaskar weighs inIPL 2025: Sunil Gavaskar, while speaking in an interview with Sports Today, spoke on MS Dhoni's decision to play this season, and shared an advice for CSK to make a comeback next season.

RCB vs CSK, Bengaluru Weather Forecast: Rain threat looms large for derbyRCB will aim to move back to the top of the IPL 2025 points table when they take on CSK at the Chinnaswamy Stadium on Saturday, May 3.  But will rain play spoilsport on the day?

Bengaluru look to reclaim top spot as Chennai start playing for prideIPL 2025, RCB vs CSK: Royal Challengers Bengaluru are looking to reclaim their top spot while Chennai Super Kings will play for pride when they face each other on Saturday at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium.

Scoring 200-plus can't always be the norm: SRH's Jaydev Unadkat on poor IPL 2025SRH bowler Jaydev Unadkat feels that always aiming to score 200-plus runs can't be the norm in the IPL any more after the loss to GT. Hyderabad's season has been an underwhelming one, as they have struggled to replicate their form from 2024.

Vaibhav Arora credits Bravo, Bharat Arun for improved death bowlingIPL 2025: In an exclusive chat with Sports Today, KKR fast bowler Vaibhav Arora said how working with Bharat Arun and Bharat Arun has helped him become a better death bowler.

Did MS Dhoni play one season too many in IPL 2025? Sunil Gavaskar weighs inIPL 2025: Sunil Gavaskar, while speaking in an interview with Sports Today, spoke on MS Dhoni's decision to play this season, and shared an advice for CSK to make a comeback next season.

RCB vs CSK, Bengaluru Weather Forecast: Rain threat looms large for derbyRCB will aim to move back to the top of the IPL 2025 points table when they take on CSK at the Chinnaswamy Stadium on Saturday, May 3.  But will rain play spoilsport on the day?

Bengaluru look to reclaim top spot as Chennai start playing for prideIPL 2025, RCB vs CSK: Royal Challengers Bengaluru are looking to reclaim their top spot while Chennai Super Kings will play for pride when they face each other on Saturday at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium.

Scoring 200-plus can't always be the norm: SRH's Jaydev Unadkat on poor IPL 2025SRH bowler Jaydev Unadkat feels that always aiming to score 200-plus runs can't be the norm in the IPL any more after the loss to GT. Hyderabad's season has been an underwhelming one, as they have struggled to replicate their form from 2024.

CSK are not going to panic, can compete with any team: Hussey ahead of RCB clashChennai Super Kings batting coach Mike Hussey said that CSK have not slipped into panic mode despite becoming the first side to be ruled out of the IPL play-off race.

Consistent GT top 3 playing good cricket shots with no slogging: Gerald CoetzeeGerald Coetzee heaped praise on GT's top three batters, saying that the trio are playing good cricket shots with minimal slogging. Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan and Jos Buttler are amongst the top run-getters in IPL 2025.

RCB won't treat CSK clash differently: Padikkal calm ahead of mega clashDevdutt Padikkal has played down any need for special planning ahead of RCB's high-voltage clash against CSK, backing the team's usual preparation as enough for a game that has become one of the most emotionally charged fixtures in the IPL.

Worst bowling unit of IPL 2025, pitch changes: SRH's downfall decoded by UnadkatFollowing the loss to GT in Ahmedabad, Jaydev Unadkat feels that the collective failure of the bowling unit and change in pitches has been the main reasons behind SRH's downfall in IPL 2025.

Angry young man Shubman Gill shows glimpse of future avatar in IPL 2025Shubman Gill was left furious several times on Friday, May 2 as GT thrashed SRH in Ahmedabad. Was this the first glimpse of a passionate leader that the fans got to see in the Indian Premier League?

Prasidh Krishna 2.0 gears up for England tour after swinging success in IPL 2025After taking IPL 2025 by storm, Gujarat Titans pacer Prasidh Krishna is now gearing up for India's demanding red-ball tour of England. With the control he displayed throughout the tournament, he has positioned himself as one of India's most promising pace options.

Still on vacation mode, SRH all but knocked out of IPL 2025SunRisers Hyderabad were hammered by Gujarat Titans on May 2, in IPL 2025. SRH players failed to grasp the pace of the game after their week-long vacation at the Maldives.

Rs 199 to Rs 44,999: Neeraj Chopra Classic's tickets go liveTickets for the Neeraj Chopra Classic 2025, set for May 24 at Bengaluru's Sree Kanteerava Stadium, are now available. The javelin throw event will begin at 6:30 PM IST, with gates opening at 5 PM.

With the control he displayed throughout the tournament, he has positioned himself as one of India's most promising pace options.

Still on vacation mode, SRH all but knocked out of IPL 2025SunRisers Hyderabad were hammered by Gujarat Titans on May 2, in IPL 2025. SRH players failed to grasp the pace of the game after their week-long vacation at the Maldives.

Rs 199 to Rs 44,999: Neeraj Chopra Classic's tickets go liveTickets for the Neeraj Chopra Classic 2025, set for May 24 at Bengaluru's Sree Kanteerava Stadium, are now available. The javelin throw event will begin at 6:30 PM IST, with gates opening at 5 PM.

Sunrisers Hyderabad can still qualify for IPL 2025 playoffs. Here's howIPL 2025, GT vs SRH: Sunrisers Hyderabad can still enter the playoffs through the backdoor despite their 38-run loss to the Gujarat Titans at the Narendra Modi Stadium.

IPL 2025: All round Gujarat Titans too hot to handle for Sunrisers HyderabadIPL 2025: Gujarat Titans outclassed Sunrisers Hyderabad in all departments to secure a 38-run win and deal a heavy blow to SRH's playoff aspirations. Shubman Gill's calm anchor role proved decisive in contrast to SRH's disjointed approach with the bat.

RCB are favourites to win the IPL 2025 title: Sunil GavaskarSunil Gavaskar has declared Royal Challengers Bengaluru as the favourites to win IPL 2025. Their consistent performance, especially in away matches, sets them ahead in the race.

Devdutt Padikkal not feeling any pressure in experienced RCB batting lineupIPL 2025: Royal Challengers Bengaluru batter Devdutt Padikkal emphasised that he is not feeling any pressure of being part of teh side;s lineupo which boasts massive experience in the likes of Virat Kohli and even Phil Salt.

Rashid Khan takes stunning running catch to remove Travis HeadRashid Khan pulled off one of the catches of IPL 2025 on Friday (May 2), dismissing Travis Head during the Gujarat Titans vs Sunrisers Hyderabad clash at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad.

Club World Cup: FIFA to debut body cameras for refereesFIFA has announced that referees at the Club World Cup will wear body cameras and adhere to new rules. This move aims to enhance transparency and add a unique point of view to the broadcast.
Consistent Sai Sudharsan beats Sachin Tendulkar to elite recordSai Sudharsan's blistering innings against SunRisers Hyderabad saw him become the fastest Indian to 2000 T20 runs.

Ben Stokes returns from injury as England announce squad for one-off TestEngland captain Ben Stokes has returned to the Test side after recovering from his hamstring surgery. Stokes is fit to lead England in their one-off Test match against Zimbabwe.

CSK definitely know what needs fixing: Batting coach Mike HusseyChennai Super Kings batting coach Mike Hussey said the five-time champions are not going to panic, but the management certainly knows what needs to be fixed. Notably, CSK became the first side to get knocked out of the IPL playoffs race.
Furious Shubman confronts umpire after controversial run-outShubman Gill was controversially given run out against SRH. The decision sparked debate and led to Gill confronting the match official.

Mohun Bagan's Subhasish Bose crowned Indian Men's Footballer of the yearSubhasish Bose's Player of the Year title not only rewards his outstanding season but also marks a rare and refreshing recognition for defenders in Indian football, breaking a decade-long trend of forwards dominating national accolades in the sport.

Jos Buttler becomes first England batter to complete 4000 runs in IPLJos Buttler has become the first England batter to complete 4,000 runs in the Indian Premier League (IPL), reaching this landmark in Match 51 of the IPL 2025 season against Sunrisers Hyderabad in Ahmedabad.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
